summary: SummaryGhd Platinum+ Styler 1'' Flat Iron. A smart styler with predictive technology for stronger hair and 2x more color protection.* This flat iron is a 3x winner of Allure Best of Beauty award!
details: DetailsBenefitsPre-set to the optimum temperature of 365Â°F for no extreme-heat styling damage.70% stronger hair*75% more shine**2x more color protection*Proven to deliver sleeker, smoother & healthier looking hair.*Precision milled plates with ultra gloss coating for instant frizz-free stylingUnique wishbone hinge and rounded barrel enables versatile, snag-free styling to create flat iron waves, curls and sleek styles3 Year WarrantyComes with a heat resistant, protective plate guardUniversal voltageSingle-pass stylingHeats up in 20 secondsAutomatic sleep mode after 30 minutes of non-useProfessional length 9 ft. cordUsed in Ulta Salons*reduced breakage and 2x less color fade vs a styler working at 440Âº F.FeaturesUltra-zone predictive technology monitors heat 250x per second across the plates and recognizes the thickness of your hair and speed at which you are styling to adjust the power accordingly. It ensures the optimum styling temperature of 365ÂºF to deliver ultimate results, personalized to you.Item 2534043How To UseUse on dry hairSection hair into 1" sections.Ensure that the styler is as close to the root as possible before closing the plates.Gently move toward the tip of the section in one simple gliding motion.Repeat the process with each section of hair, gliding once from roots to ends.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Use on dry hairSection hair into 1" sections.Ensure that the styler is as close to the root as possible before closing the plates.Gently move toward the tip of the section in one simple gliding motion.Repeat the process with each section of hair, gliding once from roots to ends.

reviews.headline: Died at 13 months
reviews.comments: I used this 2 maybe 3x per week. It wasn't the best flat iron to begin with especially thicker, course hair but then it died . Way too expensive not worth it .

reviews.headline: Red Button of Death
reviews.comments: It performed well while it lasted. Curled, straightened and ultimately I believed protected my hair. However to spend $250+ and it bately last 2 years is ridiculous and very very disappointng. I loved this tool but my feelings ate hurt to have to buy another so soon. Wobt go back with ghd after this. I was extremely excited to afford this brand after saving 200$ in ulta points and Im extremely let down.

reviews.headline: Terrible
reviews.comments: This is short and bulky. Hair fets caughtvup and doesnt glide through hair smoothly. It is the worse the straightner i have tried.

reviews.headline: bad for thick hair
reviews.comments: it cant get hot enough for my thick hair ans tugs on it everytime i pass it through

reviews.headline: One Year of love :/
reviews.comments: Jeez, I got this thing because I saw a ton of positive reviews. Bought it in January 2024, and by February 2025, it started flashing red and I couldn't use it anymore. Seems like this is a pretty common issue! It worked great while it lasted, but honestly, for the price, it's not worth it. I had a babyliss for 10 years and never had a single problem with it!

reviews.headline: Excellent product
reviews.comments: Excellent product.  It took me literally less than 10 minutes to straighten my hair!  Did I mention my hair is coarse and wavy?  WOW!!!!

reviews.headline: Works amazing!!
reviews.comments: I bought the Shark Flex Styler and my hair wouldnt hold the curls so i returned it and bought this. It works amazing!! My curls hold for a long time and look beautiful! It calms the frizz and i dont have to use a whole can of hair spray. I highly recommend this product!

reviews.headline: Great Performance, But Doesn't Last
reviews.comments: I really like this flat iron, and it does a good job, but it doesn't last. As several others have stated, a red blinking light will eventually appear, and it will completely stop working. This is my second one, and the same thing happened within a year! Very disappointing!! Not worth the money.

reviews.headline: My new everyday go to!!
reviews.comments: This is a magical device!  Does not pull or snag and leaves my hair silky.  I have never had a ghd before, and now I can see why this brand has such good reviews.

reviews.headline: Didn't even last a year!
reviews.comments: Straighter slides of counters and any bump will make it die! For the price of this straighter it should be able to withstand bumps!

reviews.headline: Glides through your hair
reviews.comments: I love this straightener.  My best friend has one and I used hers while on vacation together.  Had to come home and get my own.  Sleek design and it just glides right through your hair.  My only "complaint" is the temp is not adjustable.  Sometimes you just need a little more heat.

reviews.headline: Purchased for second time
reviews.comments: I love this flat iron.  It straightens my wavy frizzy hair and it doesn't feel course.  The only issue I have is it catches some of my hair at the end of the plates.  It pulls out a few strands of hair every now and then.

reviews.headline: too $$$ for iron that always gets hair caught in corners
reviews.comments: I wanted to love this flat iron but the inability to adjust the temp can be frustrating when it goes off memory if you didn't use exactly as needed from start to finish. Worst thing is the design causes your hair to get caught in the corners of the floating plates and pulls it out especially when you're doing multiple passes to one section of hair which is necessary to achieve the desired look. I blow dry my hair first with a round brush and then use this to achieve the shiny frizz free flat ironed look that normally lasts for several days but with this flat iron I have to run very thin sections of hair through the iron at least 10 times to straighten and shine and if I take too much hair in a section then it won't hold. This makes it extremely time consuming when you have a lot of hair. Even if I take my time with very small sections and run it through 10 times a section it will still fall out the minute I enter any type of humid environment. It is pretty durable and seems like it will hold up for several years but I doubt it will last 12 years like my previous flat iron made by another co. for the price it  had better! really thought this was gonna just blow me away but it didn't and I've been flat ironing my curls for over 20 years and have used only professional grade irons. it is better than most but not as good as I expected or it could be. the hair getting caught should have been fixed prior to mass production by simply testing the product first.

reviews.headline: Worth every penny!
reviews.comments: I had the original GHD straighter for 13 years and it finally gave in.. I loved it and was determine to purchase the exact same one but figured I'd give this one a try and couldn't be happier. It heats up in seconds and leaves your hair healthier than before if you can belive that with incredible shine. I'm obsessed.

reviews.headline: Product is completely defective, do not buy.
reviews.comments: Got the red light and the iron stopped working and the off button didn't work. This is a complete failure. Ulta should reimburse all customers who bought this total waste of money. Also beware, I took it overseas with me and it stopped working at 220 V. So the dual voltage is also a complete fail. I can't believe they are still selling this like they don't know the issues. Stop lying to the public. Total waste of money.

reviews.headline: Longevity is no longer relevant
reviews.comments: I'm reading reviews on multiple flat irons once again, because my 1" GHD platinum + that I've only had for 2 years now has the dreaded red light and will not turn on or heat up. I did love how fast it heated up and how well I could straighten and curl my hair with it. Of course my previous purchase was not tied to my Ulta account, so I have no proof of purchase to try to replace under manufacturer warranty (my fault). My flat iron prior to this one was a Babyliss that lasted me 12 years. I should have stuck with that brand, although the reviews from the current irons they offer are not promising.

reviews.headline: Not worth the price
reviews.comments: For the price of this you would think it would last longer than 2 years. I cannot get this thing to turn off unless I completely unplug it. The button to turn off does not work which is weird considering it is that same button to turn it on. Aside from not being able to adjust the temperature and it leaves kinks in the hair. And of course it went up in price since it was purchased 2 years ago. Supposedly there is a 3 year manufacturer warranty but there is no info on how to get that started. Its like a mouse hunt. ðŸ™„

reviews.headline: Beware of Red light!
reviews.comments: Ive owned 2 of these GHD, the most recent one being this white one.  When i plug it, the red light turns on and it will not heat up anymore. I reached out to them and they cant help because i didnt buy warranty.

reviews.headline: Returned and was not worth the cost.
reviews.comments: Def not worth the price. I have long hair and a basic curling iron, wand or straightener did better than this.

reviews.headline: Second one bought within a year
reviews.comments: Take my review and trust this. This is my second time around paying for this same exact straightner within the same year. My first one completely broke and had a red flashing beep that never was fixed and would turn on once and a while. I repurchased 3 weeks ago, and the red beep came again. So disappointed its been my favorite straightner but the price is way too high for this to keep occuring. Do not recommend.

faceoff_positive.comments:
To give the ghd Platinum + Styler a fair shot, I did my normal routine when I decide to flat iron my hair.  It's usually because I washed my hair the night before and was too tired to blow it out which happens.  ðŸ˜‚  I used a detangling spray on my damp hair after washing and let it air dry.  I slept with my air dried hair up in a loose top knot. For reference, my hair is at about a 2c, is thick stubborn and very prone to frizz. It's also color treated all over along with balayage highlights.  That mess you see is usually the state of my hair before I style it in the morning.

I plugged it in and pressed the power button located in the inner portion of the flat iron.  The button lit up and made a sound indicating that it is on.  The light indicated that it was ready for use instantly which was a surprise to me.  This styling tool seemed very ergonomically designed and felt good around my hand, causing me not to strain my wrists which suffers from carpal tunnel syndrome.  It was also weighted but not heavy.

Before using the ghd Platinum +, I sectioned my hair and sprayed each section with a heat protectant right before I passed it with the flat iron. 

My main observations during usage was that the flat iron was not incredibly hot like some previous ones I have used even in or around the temperature that the ghd platinum + remains in (365 degrees) and my hair cools down to the touch after each pass almost immediately.  There was no sizzle and smoke coming out of my hair so it was incredibly gentle in heat but took only two passes to achieve the results I wanted.  The hair straighteners that I've used in the past took higher heat and more passes to get my hair straight which I know definitely causes major damage in my already vulnerable color treated hair.  It took me about 25 mins to finish my entire head of hair when I normally take about 30-40 mins with other flat irons which was a very pleasant surprise.  After usage, I applied hair oil to my mid lengths and ends for additional moisture, shine and to curb away the frizzies. 

My takeaway based on my experience and the state of my hair:  If you have hair that is constantly taking a beating from heat styling, color and bleach then you should get this flat iron.  It's gentler on your hair and doesn't require much effort like other leading hair tool brands in or around the same price point.  You get smooth results with minimal passes and it's very easy to handle while using because it was designed to fit nicely on your hand without causing strain from the urge to squeeze the plates too hard together through your hair.  In the long run, your hair will thank you.  I highly recommend it and will be using this from this day forward!
faceoff_positive.headline: Do your hair a favorâ€¦

faceoff_negative.comments: I bought because it was the most expensive so I thought would be the best. The sedu and dry bar work faster. Took me so long to straighten my hair. The grip also hurt my fingers.
faceoff_negative.headline: Time consuming
